elements.title: Nigel Bonner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nigel Bonner, an Antarctic marine mammal specialist and Polar Medal recipient, researched the Antarctic fur seal (pictured) and published "the first modern scientific study of the species" in 1968?

elements.title: Phyla canescens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the South American plant Phyla canescens has invaded wetlands and floodplains in the Murray Darling basin of Australia?

elements.title: Winchester Highlands station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Winchester Highlands station was used for church meetings in the 1880s?

elements.title: Bob Jahnke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bob Jahnke started the first Māori visual arts degree programme in New Zealand in 1991?

elements.title: Miss Wool (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kathryn Gromatski was the first Miss Wool of Texas in 1952?

elements.title: Zhang Shangwu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zhang Shangwu, a two-time gold medal gymnast at the Universiade, turned to stealing and begging in the streets after his competitive career ended with an injury?

elements.title: Good Time Women (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Rolling Stones' single "Good Time Women", released in 2010, formed the basis for their 1972 hit single "Tumbling Dice"?

elements.title: off the verandah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that criticism of armchair theorizing in anthropology has resulted in scholars "coming down off the verandah"?
